info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Chesterfield, northern Dinwiddie and southeastern Amelia Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mannboro, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sutherland around 755 PM EDT. Colonial Heights, Matoaca and Ettrick around 800 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Winterpock, Burgess, Addison, Ammon, Pocahontas State Park, Petersburg Airport, Church Road, Beach, Five Forks and Walkers. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
